column1: financial constraints and also to invest to be able to donate more in future
I'm OK with the % I donate, but I would like to make more & donate more!
I'm greedy and want to save money for my future.
I am indecisive about giving now or saving/investing to give
Lack of motivation to take the pay cut and reorganise my charitable giving
Enough to avoid moral panic but not enough for moral satisfaction
Partly financial constraints, partly social/family norms, partly irrational risk aversion

Donating without being involved with the organization doesn't make me feel as good as volunteering, and doesn't scale with the amount given. Being able to give small amounts when I'm asked gives more status than giving large amounts to effective organizations anonymously. But I'm trying to become more educated and more self-less is my giving, I'm just finding it difficult. Especially when I don't see the impact of my donations directly.
Not organized, not yet done that
because I'm a student, I would like to track how I spend each month, to give maybe 10% of that
still need to get things sorted and has some big expenses past couple of years
I didn't make time to think about my yearly donations in 2017
Loss aversion, and perception of financial constraints

Me and My Wife, do donate 50% of income annually, and plan to give nearly all to charity on death, but often feel I could and should do more annually, and feel i do spend on questionable value luxuries in particular. However compared to many I seem to donate excessive - and I have family who may disagree. I spend far less than many  peers - but more than others - uncertain the right balance.
I am investing my net income in passive income streams to increase my future donation capabilities.
Money isn't mine, parents have a mortgage and other payments they ought to make. I plan on intentionally avoiding such constraints so I can give more.
Procrastinating in sitting down and doing it; egoism
Because I haven't been able to produce as much as I would have liked yet
I just started increasing the along I donate, and I haven't reached my ideal state yet
Uncertainty about own future income/ plans, some reservations about whether donating is always the optimal solution, even for effect charities.
Selfishness, not quite living up to my beliefs.
I spend extra money on my own project
I'm building up my runaway capital
Not sure how much I can afford to donate
No attachment to causes and organizations
Akrasia; also uncertainty about my thought on where to donate as well as uncertainty about the value of donating now versus investing and donating a larger amount later
I currently rely on calculators which, given my status, don't request a lot. I'll slowly rebalance as I gain independence, I expect.
out of fear that I would need the money later (which I normally wouldn't, but one never knows)
financial constraint, willpower, joint decision-making with my spouse
Confusion about how much I'm obligated to donate and when I should do it
Disagreement with partner about how much to donate
I donate precisely what I think I should
Efficacy concerns. I'd rather set aside donations in a DAF if I don't feel there's a good opportunity.
Still identifying and organizing priorities and opportunities
Stinginess--it's hard to let go of as much money as I would like to give.
trying to balance savings/retirement/spending with giving
Due to psychological constraints. Increasing amount I donate every few months.
Haven't prioritized it enough in the past
student & the money is my parents' so it feels wierd
I am a student, but even though I don't have a proper income I could donate some, but I'm more selfish than I like. Also, May Balls are expensive.
Still have strong attachment to my savings
Compromise with spouse over financial goals
Don't feel a strong connection to any charity currently, so been saving money
I am building my life investing in myself. Also my income is low
I have inadequate control over my spending.
Motivation and perceived social pressure that its weird to donate more, man.
I only donate 10%. I would like to donate more but have not yet done enough research into my financial situation to know if I can afford to.
I want  to be sure of the cause
Lack of awareness of charities and usage of money
I'm selfish and don't want to live in poverty...
Still trying to find better suffering reduction donation opportunities
for mental reasons. As bad as it sounds, I still find it mentally hard to let go of money.
I would like to have more to give!
Uncertainty over giving now / giving later
I donate less than I would like to due to greed
nudging towards 10 percent of net income
A mix of finances and complex psychological processes.
Don't have a stable personal income
Figuring out my life donation plan
I am uncertain for where the future will lead me, and will be with little income for the next 6-7 years. I would rather like to have some margin to go on now than to regret giving later
I'd like to donate more, but want to get housing sorted first so I have a larger amount to donate each month. Also, I need to get my budget in order as well.
I wish I'd been more proactive about donating the amount I wanted and worried about precise money source details less.
Family reasons + my income is too low
Because my husband isn't as philanthropically inclined as I am and he is the breadwinner
Because I am saving for a house
Laziness, selfishness, can<89>Ûªt bring myself to donate more
I do not make any money right now.
I'll have to figure out tax regulations better

I have major difficulties prioritizing as I expect a mass extinction event may no longer be avoidable. Assuming one happens (let's assume climate change) I'd like to understand better what charities make provisions for reducing the effect and improving life afterwards.
Worried about not having enough money to provide ourselves and our children with options.

I don't trust charities.  I prefer to spread my income through giving out assets such as my <e5><a3>6k car to a friend struggling with alcoholism and drug addiction and going on volunteering holidays where I leave all clothes and assets behind ... apart from what I need for the flight home!
Psychologically hard to give away money.
I would have donated more, but am currently saving money as I wanted to build up a runway. And I'm spending money to upskill. In the longer term I would like to shift that money to direct donations.
Uncertainty about how much money we will need for the future
financial constraints & haven't set up system (decision paralysis)
Nervous about donating large amounts; unsure about future economic status
I am recently employed need to create a budget
I'm stingy and I need to get over it
I battle with my instincts to save and be more secure w
By donating less now and investing it, I can donate substantially more later via investment income
Recently started working for the first time after college and trying to figure out what seems realistic to donate. Hoping to up my donations significantly.
I owe my parents back a lot of tuition money and even though I<89>Ûªm not paying interest, I feel bad about not prioritizing paying them back
Have plenty of money but spend more than I "should"
Lack of secure employment for husband
Difficult to change amount of donation

I would like to donate more, but I'm concerned that I'll later come to believe that I ought to have donated less in the past so that I could have more money in the present to spend on myself to enable me to spend my time doing direct work.
I haven't decided how to budget for additional giving.
I'm not sure how much good it does
financial constraints & less altruistic than I want to be
Pressures to spend on other activities
saving for grad school, expectation of bootstrapping my own company, greed
Am a student, much of my finances were strongly connected to rest of the family before this year
Just haven't made it a focus yet
Divorce was expensive, rebuilding personal safety nets and assets
Having difficulty making myself live less luxuriously
I tend to be cautious with money and in my ability to manage it and know how much it's "safe" for me to give
Trouble dividing spend between charity and saving
because I have not yet found the charities I  want to support
Thinking about "donating now vs later" with consideration to investment gains (crypto) and haste consideration
As a student on a student loan money is more limited
Financial insecurity, particularly regarding housing. Would particularly aim to ramp up once living space sorted.
Hard to motivate myself to take the plunge
Not sure where to give next
Because I am a bad person. I think I should donate much more to be morally decent but I do not. I think this is in part easy because I donate far more than most of my collegues
risk-averse so need larger financial buffer
no Xrisk reducing targets short of funding that are convincing to me
Phase of my life: bought a house, wanting children, feeling responsible as a (possible) parent and partner. It was easier when I was single.
Spend too much on personal life, social activities and traveling
Preserving career flexibility early in career
I am a teenager in high school without a job

My outgoings are probably higher than they should be, which limits my donations. I am saving money for a house deposit, which limits my donations. I do not want to appear to be fiscally irresponsible to my partner (who is not an effective altruist), I earn a good wage - but a higher wage would mean higher donations.
spouse, need for research/planning, uncertain about retirement
I want to evaluate the donations on my life and impact on standard of living.
I am starting a business in the hope that I can use its revenue to donate. Due to a lack of income at present I'm unable to donate as much as I would like right now.
I'm hesitant because of my uncertain financial future
Irregular income due to being self employed

Haven't figured out how to manage future uncertainty well enough to give more regularly yet; don't want to shift existing budget away from helping individuals, I know it's generally less effective overall but feels much more personal and thus important
Because I'm a little scared of signing up on a donation website. But the fear is irrational and I will so it soon.
Due to not prioritizing it, plus some financial obligations
Would like a better way to budget for it

I donate a significant amount of time to an EAA organisation. Doing this means I spend money to gain more time (eg, not cooking my own food, being more willing to spend money on taxis etc), hence I haven't been able to increase my proportion of income donated.
Need to factor in investment opportunity cost, using a rough donation discount factor of 15%
Waiting to finish building savings runway and establish next step in career
Still under a ton of cause uncertainty, hope to scale up as we learn more
currently doing a sabbatical, replacing money donations with time donations (volunteering 20h/week for EA Zurich)
I also want to save some money. Get some financial freedom after years (decades? _<d9><f7><db>) of debt...
I Safe money to start my own projects.
Analysis paralysis and lack of information
I donate nothing because I'm living on a minimal salary to save my non profit the most amount of money possible.
I'm saving money to be able to maybe switch careers
I am very confused about what is best.
I am involved in groups and such which require more money than I have spent in the past.
I have very little money, and also don't know of places to donate it that would excite me other than my own org. So I just work for my own org.
due my financial constraints at the moment
I would love to donate billions of dollars
Poor financial management and fear of own financial security despite having a good income

I'm selfish and risk averse and like saving money
Just haven't got around to it

because of being a student till now

slowly increasing the amount of donations for motivational reasons
